text: hello this is Bill Cunningham reporting
on the recent New York fashion
collections for next fall and what an
exciting week it is the thing that
strikes me that so wonderful is the
diversity the diversity of the audience
in the front row the diversity of the
showings and the sights of the showings
they went from a spectacular Marc Jacobs
show in the armory at twenty fifth
Street where he always has it and Bill's
an enormous set in total contrast was an
enchanting little show by the designer
Yoli held in an abandoned former
millinery supply store on 38 street
cheers just randomly placed around for
the 150 guests a little banjo combo
playing music an American flag on a
stick poked into a hole in the wall a
group of photographers and I thought by
heavens that's the way the shows were
when I came on the scene in 1948 there
was none of the hoopla we know today it
was this simplicity I mean you talk
about diversity the next show is in the
former main post office where the mail
trucks pulled in to be loaded under a
skyline docking area and fashion as
theater could not have been more
brilliantly played out than at Tom Brown
it was a huge gallery and they were male
models bound bondage I guess you'd call
it to Ron iron beds painted white and
they were all in gray flannel suits
obviously
reflecting back to the gray flannel man
of the 1950s and then his models came
out in the most fantastic shape coats
and suits but that's the diversity of
Fashion Week in New York it's just
absolutely amazing and then on the
guests coming to the show death is a
show on its own and and I thought this
year the diversity of thought was what
interested me and the contrast of
thought where the women indicating the
idea that it might happen a full-skirted
winter coats as opposed to others in
very classic banished Eiland a classic
coats then there was another thing at
the shows on the runway and off the
runway which we haven't had for a number
of years this whole thing about skirt
went because what most people wore pants
or leggings or tights well suddenly
designers are showing hems and it down
to the mid calf be careful we had a
fiasco in that 1970 called the MIDI
which was it nearly killed the whole
fashion world it was so awful and but
here we come again and many of the
audience I saw reflecting this and then
of course color all of these coats made
of blocks of color and so ideas were
floating every which way during Fashion
Week people are always saying oh aren't
you tired oh my god I'm not tired I'm
exhilarated
